div.div: Incident at Galeries Lafayette: Police Crack Down on Juvenile "Luxury Theft"
div.p: PARIS — A 14-year-old girl was taken into custody yesterday evening following a security incident at the flagship Galeries Lafayette store on Boulevard Haussmann.
According to police reports, store security intercepted the minor as she attempted to exit the premises with concealed high-end cosmetics and designer accessories valued at over €1,200.

The situation escalated when responding officers conducted a standard search of the suspect’s belongings. Sources close to the investigation confirmed to The Herald that a quantity of controlled substances—allegedly prescription painkillers not registered to the minor—were discovered in her handbag.

"We are seeing a disturbing trend of affluent youth engaging in high-risk recreational theft," said a spokesperson for the Paris Préfecture de Police. "When narcotics are involved, it crosses a line. The District Prosecutor intends to pursue charges to send a clear message."
The minor, whose identity is withheld due to her age, is believed to have family connections in the Lyon area. She is currently being held pending the arrival of a guardian.
The Prosecutor’s office declined to comment further on ongoing juvenile matters.
div.div:
Twelve hundred euros. And pills.
God help me. I fix other people's messes, but I didn't even see this building up in my own house.
Julien said he would "handle it." I hate that I have to let him.
The Lyon Herald · National Desk · Paris/Lyon Edition
